titleInfo.title: Helping Parents Work and Children Succeed: A Guide to Child Care and the 1996 Welfare Act

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

mods.abstract: This report examines the many options that policymakers may consider and presents recommendations for policy choices that address both workforce development and child development. The report also presents information on grants and assists states in providing child care for all families - The New Child Care Development Block Grant, part of the New Welfare Act and the Temporary Assistance for Needy Families Block Grant (TANF), which replaced Aid to Families with Dependent Children (AFDC). Transitional Child Care and At-Risk Child Care are also discussed.
